Edava is a long expanded coastal village in Thiruvananthapuram district in the state of Kerala, India.

value: View of the Arabian Sea from Vettakada beach

Edava is located north of the tourist spot Varkala.
It has cliffs, serene beaches and backwaters with its canals and lakes.
The main beach areas are Odayam, Manthara, Vettakada and Kappil.
Slowly the tourism develops on the seaside, so you will find some guesthouses, homestays and restaurants.

value: 1 hour from Trivandrum; Edava is linked by state and national highways to all the major cities in Kerala, Tamil Nadu and Karnataka.
State Transport Buses are available from Trivandrum via Varkala(direction Manthara Temple),or Kollam. Bus service available from Varkala or Kollam to many parts of South Kerala and Kanyakumari

Edava railway station. The nearest main railway station is Varkala. Varkala is also connected by Rail Network. If coming from Trivandrum and Cochin, the better option will be coming by Train. Almost all trains passing by stops at Varkala. From Varkala Railway Station, Taxis and Auto Rickshaws can be hired. Edava is around 5km from Varkala Railway Station. (Rs 80-100 by Auto Rickshaw)
directions=on the seaside past the Manthara temple in Edava, about 30 min walk north from Varkala Beach
price=Homestay Rs 350-800, pending on length and season, double or single occupation

content= A Homestay, Bed and Breakfast. Simple, comfortable rooms with attached shower/toilet. English, Malayalam, Hindi, German, French, Italian and some Spanish spoken.

content=A really romantic place in the backside of Odayam Beach with the great view over the hole beach. 5 rooms, with sit-outs, a roof top, garden are there. Breakfast is available, and local food by order is made by Safers family. Great atmosphere ! saferkasali@yahoo.com
